title: Cyanixia
text:
Cyanixia is a genus of plants in the <a href="Iridaceae">Iridaceae</a>, first described in 2003. It contains only one known species, Cyanixia socotrana, a <a href="perennial">perennial</a>, <a href="herbaceous">herbaceous</a> and <a href="bulb">bulbous plant</a> species <a href="endemism">endemic</a> to the Island of <a href="Socotra">Socotra</a> in the <a href="Indian%20Ocean">Indian Ocean</a>, part of the <a href="Republic%20of%20Yemen">Republic of Yemen</a>.
The genus name is derived from <a href="Greek%20language">Greek</a> words "Ixia", referring to the radially symmetrical flowers in the genus of that name, as well as "cyanos", meaning "blue". The species was for many years considered a member of the South African genus "<a href="Babiana">Babiana</a>" but recognized as a distinct genus in 2003.
